wpt.name: GC2MCBB
wpt.desc: Take a Hike! by JeepFeet, Unknown Cache (2/2)

groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:name: Take a Hike!
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:long_description:
This caching adventure will have you taking a two mile round trip Hike. You can begin your journey from the parking area by following the nicely paved Brandywine Trail. After some distance, this path will take you across a small bridge. Just continue following the path as it turns around the bend to the right, but be on the lookout for the entrance of a White Blazed Dirt Trail (which will soon appear on your left). At this point, you should leave the paved path and begin following the white blaze dirt trail, which will take you the rest of the way to the cache location.
 
Please Note: The posted coordinates are for the Trailhead Parking Area (Not the Cache Location!). You will need to solve the puzzle below to find the coordinates for the actual cache location.
_____________________________________
Congratulations to Mr Picnic (bpp_picnic) on FTF!

The cache on our trail is located at: N 39° 59.ABC  W 075° 41.DEF
 
But the puzzle questions are based on a different Hiking Trail...
A very famous hiking trail that is over 2000 miles long!
- This famous trail is often referred to as the A.T.
- The name of this trail begins with the letter A
- The name of this trail ends with the letter N
 
To find the missing coordinate numbers (ABC & DEF) just answer the following questions about this more famous Hiking Trail.

A - Can you guess or figure out the Name of the puzzle's Famous Hiking Trail?
 
___?___Trail.. A = count up the number of letters, then subtract 11
 
B - How many letters are in the name of the most Northern State of this trail?
 
_____?_____ B = count up the number of letters, then subtract 1
 
C - How many letters are in the name of the most Southern State of this trail?
 
_____?_____ C = just count up the number of letters
 
D - How many letters are in the name of the State that has this trail's Middle Point?
 
_____?_____ D = count up the number of letters, then subtract 10

E - How many letters are in the name of the State that has this trail’s Headquarters?
 
_____?_____ E = count up the number of letters, then subtract 11
 
F - You can hike along sections of this famous trail in how many States?
 
_____?_____ F = subtract 5 from the total number of states
 

You can check here to see if your coordinates are correct...
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:encoded_hints: at the base of a large multi-trunked bush

groundspeak:log.groundspeak:text: Good exercise, pleasant woods, and a cache-- a great combo. TFTC
